<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LABOR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/04/google-employees-form-union-rare-silicon-valley-organizing-effort?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Google Has Search, Maps, YouTube, and Now…
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Google union gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/bGn1XMMW3EglSYFNV6/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Google union gif" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/bGn1XMMW3EglSYFNV6/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A union. The rift between Google employees and management continued to escalate Monday, when 226 workers revealed they had formed the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/04/opinion/google-union.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Alphabet Workers Union</a>, a reference to Google's parent company. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The group will be supported by the Communications Workers of America, which operates in the IT and telecom industries.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>In Silicon Valley, unions are rarer than personal style. Salaries aren't particularly contentious because they're already quite high, and the tech industry's globally scattered workforces are hard to organize, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/04/technology/google-employees-union.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the NYT</a>. So this development is...a major development. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But it's not surprising </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For years, Google employees have criticized management for their approach to issues including sexual harassment in the workplace, the company's work with the Pentagon, and treatment of contract workers. A few examples:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In 2018, more than 20,000 Googlers </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2018/11/01/662851489/google-employees-plan-global-walkout-to-protest-companys-treatment-of-women?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">walked out</a></span><span> of work to protest the company's handling of sexual assault claims.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>That same year, thousands of employees </span><span><a href="https://globalnews.ca/news/4125382/google-pentagon-ai-project-maven/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">signed a petition</a></span><span> protesting Google's work with Project Maven, a Defense Department initiative that could theoretically improve the precision of drone strikes. Google discontinued the contract.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The most recent flashpoint was the December 2020 firing of leading AI ethics researcher Timnit Gebru, a Black woman who </span><span><a href="https://www.platformer.news/p/the-withering-email-that-got-an-ethical?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> Google dismissed her because she was fighting bias in algorithms.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In response to the new union, Google's Director of People Operations Kara Silverstein said, "We've always worked hard to create a supportive and rewarding workplace for our workforce. Of course, our employees have protected labor rights that we support. But as we've always done, we'll continue engaging directly with all our employees."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Other labor organizing efforts in tech are in the works. Kickstarter workers unionized last year, and Amazon warehouse workers in Alabama <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/12/18/947632289/amazon-warehouse-workers-in-alabama-plan-vote-on-1st-u-s-union?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will likely vote</a> in a few weeks on whether to form the company's first U.S. union. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/04/amazon-jpmorgan-berkshire-close-healthcare-venture-haven?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
If Bezos, Dimon, and Buffett Can't Do It...
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Amazon, JPMorgan, and Berkshire Hathaway confirmed they're <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/04/haven-the-amazon-berkshire-jpmorgan-venture-to-disrupt-healthcare-is-disbanding-after-3-years.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disbanding Haven</a>, their high-profile, would-be healthcare disruptor. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Investors were more excited for the joint venture's arrival in January 2018 than Bachelor nation was for last night's premiere. Haven's premature demise is a reminder that the U.S. healthcare sector is <em>incredibly</em> resistant to makeovers, even with three iconic American corporations working together.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What went wrong? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A big part of the problem, CNBC reports, was that each company was also running separate healthcare projects, which sort of defeated the point of working together to tackle rising employee healthcare costs. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>After two years, Haven's biggest announcements were 1) its name and 2) </span><span><a href="https://www.geekwire.com/2019/amazon-jpmorgan-roll-new-health-insurance-plans-part-haven-joint-venture/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">no-deductible plans</a></span><span> with wellness incentives for employees of Amazon, JPMorgan, and some Berkshire companies. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The joint venture also faced </span><span><a href="https://www.beckershospitalreview.com/hospital-management-administration/haven-sees-exodus-of-execs-8-things-to-know.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">departures</a></span><span> from several high-profile execs, including CEO Atul Gawande last May. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>even without Haven, Amazon has <a href="https://www.mobihealthnews.com/news/amazon-dives-deeper-health-2020?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">big healthcare plans</a>, including the wearable health tracker Amazon Halo, virtual and in-person Amazon Care clinics for employees, new Alexa features, and prescription deliveries through its digital Amazon Pharmacy.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/04/chinas-onetime-richest-man-jack-ma?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Where Is Jack Ma?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Jack Ma" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjAzL2phY2tfbWEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Wang HE/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's a question many in the business world have been asking this week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The billionaire founder of e-commerce giant Alibaba and its fintech affiliate, Ant Group, has <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/alibaba-founder-jack-ma-suspected-missing-2021-1?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not made a public appearance</a> since he gave a controversial speech at a Chinese economic forum in late October.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In that surprisingly aggressive speech, Ma criticized Chinese regulators for throwing a wet blanket on innovation in the financial sector. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">He got sent to the principal's office   </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On November 2, a few days after the speech, Ma was called in by authorities for questioning. Ant's IPO, which was expected to be the largest in history, was nixed the next day. And after Ma <a href="https://time.com/5926062/jack-ma/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">missed an appearance</a> as a judge on his own <em>Shark Tank-</em>esque TV show last week, raised eyebrows turned into raised alarms. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Ma could be sipping Mai Tai's on a secluded beach for all we know, but given his recent run-ins with Chinese authorities, investors are <a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/alibaba-stock-price-jack-ma-prolonged-public-absence-raises-eyebrows-2021-1-1029931229?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">starting to get antsy</a>. Alibaba's stock fell a little over 3% yesterday.</p>

<tr>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

</a>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If 2020's focus was the healthcare response to the pandemic, 2021 "will overwhelmingly be about economic responses to Covid-19's lingering symptoms and scar tissue (debt burdens and misaligned politics)," Eurasia Group wrote in its <a href="https://www.eurasiagroup.net/issues/top-risks-2021?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">2021 political risk report</a>, published yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More than 7 billion people need to be vaccinated. Countries are facing higher unemployment, rising debt loads, and unequal recoveries. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">That's not even the No. 1 risk</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So what's scarier than Covid-19? The U.S. government.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Specifically, a Joe Biden presidency hindered by a split Congress, growing political polarization, and unfounded allegations of a fraudulent election by outgoing President Donald Trump and other Republican lawmakers.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Fearing another "America First" president come 2024, foreign leaders may hesitate to coordinate action with the U.S. as they have following previous crises. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Other risks identified by Eurasia Group: </strong>The challenge of executing net-zero emissions plans without global coordination. Ongoing U.S.-China tensions. The departure of German chancellor (and Europe's de facto leader) Angela Merkel. More cyberattacks. The collapse in oil demand weighing on energy-producing countries. And growing calls to rein in cross-border data flows.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/04/ncaa-adopt-bubblelike-approach-host-mens-postseason-basketball-tournament?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Sometimes Plagiarism Is Okay
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Especially when it comes to safety protocols for large sporting events involving tall humans and squeaky shoes. Yesterday, the NCAA announced it will be adopting an NBA-esque <a href="https://www.espn.com/mens-college-basketball/story/_/id/30650595/ncaa-men-basketball-tournament-played-entirely-indiana?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bubble approach</a> to hosting its men's postseason basketball tournament, aka March Madness. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Basketball-lovin’ Indiana is the locale of choice, with the majority of games taking place in multiple venues across Indianapolis.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Economically, it's a mixed bag</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Division I men's tournament generates around <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/11/ncaa-bans-fans-2020-tournament-coronavirus-concerns?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$868 million annually</a> from television and marketing rights alone. That's the vast majority of the NCAA's annual revenue, so putting on a tournament at all after last year's cancellation would be a <em>Hoosiers</em>-level victory. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, the 13 metro areas that typically host opening-round matchups will miss out on the economic activity generated by UMBC fans hitting the town to celebrate an upset win. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>While the NBA's bubble experiment for the 2020 season provided a blueprint for the NCAA, March Madness is a much bigger logistical challenge. Only 22 NBA teams entered the Orlando bubble, but 68 will arrive in Indiana this March.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"></strong><strong style="color:#000">Help us help you: </strong>This newsletter is only made possible through our brand partnerships, and sometimes, we need to know a little more about you to make those partnerships really click. GOP Sen. David Perdue is facing Democrat Jon Ossoff, and GOP Sen. Kelly Loeffler is facing Democrat Raphael Warnock. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nLABOR \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/04/google-employees-form-union-rare-silicon-valley-organizing-effort?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nGoogle Has Search, Maps, YouTube, and Now…\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Google union gif\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=447 src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/bGn1XMMW3EglSYFNV6/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Google union gif\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/bGn1XMMW3EglSYFNV6/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA union. The rift between Google employees and management continued to escalate Monday, when 226 workers revealed they had formed the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/04/opinion/google-union.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAlphabet Workers Union\u003c/a\u003e, a reference to Google's parent company. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe group will be supported by the Communications Workers of America, which operates in the IT and telecom industries.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eIn Silicon Valley, unions are rarer than personal style. Salaries aren't particularly contentious because they're already quite high, and the tech industry's globally scattered workforces are hard to organize, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/04/technology/google-employees-union.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the NYT\u003c/a\u003e. So this development is...a major development. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut it's not surprising \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor years, Google employees have criticized management for their approach to issues including sexual harassment in the workplace, the company's work with the Pentagon, and treatment of contract workers. A few examples:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn 2018, more than 20,000 Googlers \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2018/11/01/662851489/google-employees-plan-global-walkout-to-protest-companys-treatment-of-women?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewalked out\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of work to protest the company's handling of sexual assault claims.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThat same year, thousands of employees \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://globalnews.ca/news/4125382/google-pentagon-ai-project-maven/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esigned a petition\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e protesting Google's work with Project Maven, a Defense Department initiative that could theoretically improve the precision of drone strikes. Google discontinued the contract.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe most recent flashpoint was the December 2020 firing of leading AI ethics researcher Timnit Gebru, a Black woman who \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.platformer.news/p/the-withering-email-that-got-an-ethical?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Google dismissed her because she was fighting bias in algorithms.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn response to the new union, Google's Director of People Operations Kara Silverstein said, \"We've always worked hard to create a supportive and rewarding workplace for our workforce. Of course, our employees have protected labor rights that we support. But as we've always done, we'll continue engaging directly with all our employees.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eOther labor organizing efforts in tech are in the works. Kickstarter workers unionized last year, and Amazon warehouse workers in Alabama \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/12/18/947632289/amazon-warehouse-workers-in-alabama-plan-vote-on-1st-u-s-union?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill likely vote\u003c/a\u003e in a few weeks on whether to form the company's first U.S. union. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Amazon, JPMorgan, and Berkshire Hathaway confirmed they're \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/04/haven-the-amazon-berkshire-jpmorgan-venture-to-disrupt-healthcare-is-disbanding-after-3-years.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisbanding Haven\u003c/a\u003e, their high-profile, would-be healthcare disruptor. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInvestors were more excited for the joint venture's arrival in January 2018 than Bachelor nation was for last night's premiere. Haven's premature demise is a reminder that the U.S. healthcare sector is \u003cem\u003eincredibly\u003c/em\u003e resistant to makeovers, even with three iconic American corporations working together.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat went wrong? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA big part of the problem, CNBC reports, was that each company was also running separate healthcare projects, which sort of defeated the point of working together to tackle rising employee healthcare costs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAfter two years, Haven's biggest announcements were 1) its name and 2) \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.geekwire.com/2019/amazon-jpmorgan-roll-new-health-insurance-plans-part-haven-joint-venture/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eno-deductible plans\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e with wellness incentives for employees of Amazon, JPMorgan, and some Berkshire companies. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf 2020's focus was the healthcare response to the pandemic, 2021 \"will overwhelmingly be about economic responses to Covid-19's lingering symptoms and scar tissue (debt burdens and misaligned politics),\" Eurasia Group wrote in its \u003ca href=\"https://www.eurasiagroup.net/issues/top-risks-2021?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e2021 political risk report\u003c/a\u003e, published yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMore than 7 billion people need to be vaccinated. Countries are facing higher unemployment, rising debt loads, and unequal recoveries. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThat's not even the No. 1 risk\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo what's scarier than Covid-19? The U.S. government.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSpecifically, a Joe Biden presidency hindered by a split Congress, growing political polarization, and unfounded allegations of a fraudulent election by outgoing President Donald Trump and other Republican lawmakers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFearing another \"America First\" president come 2024, foreign leaders may hesitate to coordinate action with the U.S. as they have following previous crises. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOther risks identified by Eurasia Group: \u003c/strong\u003eThe challenge of executing net-zero emissions plans without global coordination. Ongoing U.S.-China tensions. The departure of German chancellor (and Europe's de facto leader) Angela Merkel. More cyberattacks. The collapse in oil demand weighing on energy-producing countries. And growing calls to rein in cross-border data flows.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEspecially when it comes to safety protocols for large sporting events involving tall humans and squeaky shoes. Yesterday, the NCAA announced it will be adopting an NBA-esque \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/mens-college-basketball/story/_/id/30650595/ncaa-men-basketball-tournament-played-entirely-indiana?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebubble approach\u003c/a\u003e to hosting its men's postseason basketball tournament, aka March Madness. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBasketball-lovin’ Indiana is the locale of choice, with the majority of games taking place in multiple venues across Indianapolis.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eEconomically, it's a mixed bag\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Division I men's tournament generates around \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/11/ncaa-bans-fans-2020-tournament-coronavirus-concerns?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$868 million annually\u003c/a\u003e from television and marketing rights alone. That's the vast majority of the NCAA's annual revenue, so putting on a tournament at all after last year's cancellation would be a \u003cem\u003eHoosiers\u003c/em\u003e-level victory. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, the 13 metro areas that typically host opening-round matchups will miss out on the economic activity generated by UMBC fans hitting the town to celebrate an upset win. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWhile the NBA's bubble experiment for the 2020 season provided a blueprint for the NCAA, March Madness is a much bigger logistical challenge. Only 22 NBA teams entered the Orlando bubble, but 68 will arrive in Indiana this March.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\"
